meanings.definition: A graph that shows the relationship between two variables over time.
meanings.sent1: In science class, we learned how to interpret kymographs to understand data trends.
meanings.sent2: The kymographs displayed the temperature changes throughout the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The kymographs at the science fair were so colorful and interesting to look at.
meanings.sent4: Her progress in learning was like a kymograph, steadily increasing over time.
meanings.sent5: The kymographs on the wall made the science lab feel more exciting and dynamic.

meanings.definition: A type of scientific instrument used to record changes in a physical property over time.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used kymographs to measure the growth of the plant.
meanings.sent2: The kymographs in the lab were essential for monitoring the pressure changes.
meanings.sent3: The kymographs beeped happily whenever a new data point was recorded.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to practice was like a kymograph, capturing every improvement.
meanings.sent5: The kymographs hummed softly as they diligently recorded the experiment's results.
